background: The company is looking to determine the optimal combination of different alloys to use in the production of various steel types to maximize profit. There are constraints related to the availability, composition, and cost of the alloys, as well as the composition and selling price of the steel types produced.
constraints: For each alloy a, the amount used is non-negative and cannot exceed AvailableAlloy[a]
The carbon content in each steel type s must be at least CarbonMin[s]
The nickel content in each steel type s must not exceed NickelMax[s]
The overall materials used cannot exceed the total available amount for each alloy
For each steel type s, the amount produced is non-negative
objective: Maximize the profit from producing the different steel types, considering the cost of the alloys and the revenue from the steel
description: How much of each alloy should the company use in each type of steel, and how much of each steel type should be produced to maximize profit? The company has \param{A} different alloys and \param{S} different steel types. For each alloy \param{a} in 1, ..., \param{A}, there is an available amount of \param{AvailableAlloy}, a carbon content of \param{CarbonContent}, a nickel content of \param{NickelContent}, and an alloy price of \param{AlloyPrice}. For each steel type \param{s} in 1, ..., \param{S}, there is a steel price of \param{SteelPrice}, a minimum required carbon content of \param{CarbonMin}, and a maximum allowed nickel content of \param{NickelMax}.

parameters.definition: Total number of different steel types
Minimum required carbon content for steel type s
Maximum allowed nickel content for steel type s
